Instruction: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the elbow macaroni and cook according to package instructions for al dente pasta.
While the pasta cooks, melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly, to create a roux.
Slowly whisk in milk, one cup at a time, until the sauce is smooth and thickened. Bring to a simmer and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove the pan from heat and stir in shredded cheddar cheese, Gruyere cheese (if using), Parmesan cheese, Dijon mustard, salt, and black pepper until the cheese is melted and sauce is smooth.
Drain the cooked pasta and return it to the pot. Pour the cheese sauce over the pasta and toss to coat evenly.
Transfer the macaroni and cheese to a serving dish and garnish with a pinch of paprika (optional). Serve immediately.
